abstract: Challenges and effective ways of instruction in computer security classes (security tools, technology overviews, research projects, virtual labs, and Web resources) are discussed with examples of lecture notes, OPNETâ„¢ lab assignments, homework study cases, and projects available on the instructors' Websites. The project-based approach motivates students in exploring computer-security techniques, writing technology overviews, and conducting research, and provides them with knowledge, instructions, and hands-on experience.
